description.value: Based upon clinical judgment and if not otherwise contraindicated, consider initiating a new order for one or more of the following medications prior to the neurosurgery consultation.

NSAIDs increase the risk of serious gastrointestinal adverse events including bleeding, ulceration, and perforation of the stomach or intestines, which can be fatal. The prevailing recommendations in consensus-based clinical guidelines recommend that NSAID/Cyclo-oxygenase-2 (COX-2) should be avoided in Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD).

textEquivalent.value: Ibuprofen 400 mg tablet oral every 6 hours as needed for back pain; may increase dose frequency to one tablet every 4 hours 100 tablets 2 refills

textEquivalent.value: Naproxen 550mg tablet oral every 12 hours as needed for back pain 100 tablets 2 refills

textEquivalent.value: Acetaminophen 325 mg tablet oral two tablets every 6 hours as needed for back pain; may increase dose frequency to two tablets every 4 hours; do not take more than 10 tablets per day 100 tablets 2 refills

elm:value.value: Do not take more than 10 tablets per day

textEquivalent.value: Methylprednisolone 4 mg tablet oral by taper: take 6 tablets at once on day 1; on day 2 take one tablet before breakfast, one after lunch, one after dinner, and two at bedtime; on day 3 take one tablet before breakfast, one after lunch, one after dinner, and one at bedtime;on day 4 take one tablet before breakfast, one after lunch, and one at bedtime; on day 5 take one tablet before breakfast and one at bedtime; and on day 6 take one tablet before breakfast. 21 tablets 0 refills

elm:value.value: By taper: take 6 tablets at once on day 1; on day 2 take one tablet before breakfast, one after lunch, one after dinner, and two at bedtime; on day 3 take one tablet before breakfast, one after lunch, one after dinner, and one at bedtime;on day 4 take one tablet before breakfast, one after lunch, and one at bedtime; on day 5 take one tablet before breakfast and one at bedtime; and on day 6 take one tablet before breakfast

description.value: Consider ordering from the following consults in conjunction with the neurosurgery consult.

textEquivalent.value: Consult physical therapy to evaluate for conservative therapy for lumbar thoracic radiculopathy (e.g., structured exercise, electrical stimulation, acupuncture, exercise instruction)
Consult psychiatry to evaluate for depression and other psychological factors that may affect the patient's perception of pain and ability to manage pain

elm:value.code: [386053000 |Evaluation procedure (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[365396002 |Finding related to ability to cope with pain (finding)]

textEquivalent.value: Consult social services to evaluate social factors (e.g., joblessness, homelessness, financial concerns) that may affect patient's ability to adhere to conservative treatment

elm:value.code: [386053000 |Evaluation procedure (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[1181000205104 |Finding related to ability to adhere to conservative treatment (finding)]

textEquivalent.value: Consult pain management to address modalities for treating chronic pain

description.value: Consider ordering patient education in conjunction with the neurosurgery consult.
